thread.title_full: Brandsmart gets $3 million PACE loan for energy upgrades, largest in U.S. Southeast - Sun Sentinel

author: Doreen Hemlock
title: Brandsmart gets $3 million PACE loan energy upgrades, largest in U.S. Southeast
text:
BrandsMart USA has arranged the largest PACE loan in the U.S. Southeast to date: $3.1 million for energy upgrades at its store in Miami Gardens.
The retail chain expects the energy upgrade to produce enough savings on its electric bill to pay back all of the loan arranged through the Property Assessed Clean Energy program, known as PACE.
That means the improvements to the Miami Gardens store will cost nothing upfront and end up essentially free, according to consumer electronics and appliance retailer based in Hollywood.
The $3.1 million loan is the third major PACE deal for BrandsMart, after funding of $2.2 million for energy upgrades at a West Palm Beach store and $1.8 million for a south Miami-Dade County store.
The deal underscores a pickup in South Florida business for PACE, a finance program started in California nearly a decade ago. PACE lets property owners borrow money for energy upgrades including solar panels and then pay back the loans with their property taxes, much like an assessment.
The program helps property owners tackle the high uprfont costs for such upgrades as roof-top solar.
BrandsMart obtained its latest loan through a program run by Ygrene Energy Fund in a PACE district that now spans more than 20 municipalities in Miami-Dade County. (Ygrene is energy spelled backward.)
That South Florida program probably will provide up to $50 million in PACE loans this year, more than seven times the volume last year, said Joseph Spector, vice president of operations for Ygrene Florida.
Next year, its PACE loans could reach up to $200 million, thanks in part to new rulings by Florida's Supreme Court that uphold validations on bonds backing PACE loans, Spector said.
Some cities in Broward also are looking to join Ygrene's PACE district in South Florida, since Broward's countywide programs have not begun, Spector said.
At its Miami Gardens store, BrandsMart plans to install energy-efficient LED lights, a new more energy-efficient roof and more efficient heating, ventilation and air-conditioning equipment.
